root.title: API Root
root.description: The API root resource links to all other resources available in the API. Calling the root directory also returns details about the MailChimp user account.

authorized-apps.title: Authorized Apps
authorized-apps.description: Manage registered, connected apps for your MailChimp account with the Authorized Apps endpoints.

automation.title: Automations
automation.description: MailChimp's free [Automation](http://kb.mailchimp.com/automation/about-automation?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) feature lets you build a series of emails that send to subscribers when triggered by a specific date, activity, or event. Use the API to manage Automation workflows, emails, and queues.

automation-email.title: Emails
automation-email.description: Manage individual emails in an Automation workflow.

automation-email-queue.title: Queue
automation-email-queue.description: Manage list member queues for Automation emails.

automation-removed-subscribers.title: Removed Subscribers
automation-removed-subscribers.description: Remove subscribers from an Automation workflow.

batch-operations.title: Batch Operations
batch-operations.description: Use [batch operations](http://kb.mailchimp.com/api/article/how-to-use-batch-operations?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to complete multiple operations with a single call.

batch-webhooks.title: Batch Webhooks
batch-webhooks.description: Manage webhooks for [batch operations](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/reference/batches/). Learn more about [How to Use Batch Operations](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/how-to-use-batch-operations/).

campaigns.title: Campaigns
campaigns.description: [Campaigns](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) are how you send emails to your MailChimp list. Use the Campaigns API calls to manage campaigns in your MailChimp account.

campaign-feedback.title: Feedback
campaign-feedback.description: Post comments, reply to team feedback, and send test emails while you're [working together on a MailChimp campaign](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/design/collaborate-on-campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

campaign-checklist.title: Send Checklist
campaign-checklist.description: Review the send checklist for your campaign, and resolve any issues before sending.

campaign-content.title: Content
campaign-content.description: Manage the HTML, plain-text, and template content for your MailChimp campaigns.

conversations.title: Conversations
conversations.description: [Conversation tracking](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/set-up-and-use-conversations?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) is a paid feature that lets you view subscribers' replies to your campaigns in your MailChimp account.

conversation-messages.title: Messages
conversation-messages.description: Manage messages in a specific campaign conversation.

file-manager-files.title: File Manager Files
file-manager-files.description: Manage specific files in the File Manager for your MailChimp account. The [File Manager](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/images-videos-files/how-to-use-the-file-manager?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) is a place to store images, documents, and other files you include or link to in your campaigns, templates, or signup forms.

file-manager-folders.title: File Manager Folders
file-manager-folders.description: Manage specific folders in the File Manager for your MailChimp account. The [File Manager](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/images-videos-files/how-to-use-the-file-manager?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) is a place to store images, documents, and other files you include or link to in your campaigns, templates, or signup forms.

lists.title: Lists
lists.description: A MailChimp list is a powerful and flexible tool that helps you manage your contacts. Learn how to [get started with lists in MailChimp](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/growth/getting-started-with-lists?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

list-members.title: Members
list-members.description: Manage members of a specific MailChimp list, including currently subscribed, unsubscribed, and bounced members.

list-merges.title: Merge Fields
list-merges.description: Manage [merge fields](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/manage-list-and-signup-form-fields?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) (formerly merge vars) for a specific list.

abuse-reports.title: Abuse Reports
abuse-reports.description: Manage [abuse complaints](http://kb.mailchimp.com/accounts/compliance-tips/about-abuse-complaints?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) for a specific list. An abuse complaint occurs when your recipient reports an email as spam in their mail program.

list-activity.title: Activity
list-activity.description: Get recent daily, aggregated activity stats for your list. For example, view unsubscribes, signups, total emails sent, opens, clicks, and more, for up to 180 days.

list-clients.title: Clients
list-clients.description: Get information about the most popular email clients for subscribers in a specific MailChimp list.

list-growth-history.title: Growth History
list-growth-history.description: View a summary of the month-by-month [growth activity](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/all-about-list-stats?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#listgrowth) for a specific list.

list-webhooks.title: Webhooks
list-webhooks.description: Manage [webhooks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/how-to-set-up-webhooks?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) for a specific MailChimp list.

interest-categories.title: Interest Categories
interest-categories.description: Manage interest categories for a specific list. Interest categories organize interests, which are used to group subscribers based on their preferences. These correspond to 'group titles' in the MailChimp application. [Learn more about groups in MailChimp](http://kb.mailchimp.com/segments/how-to-use-groups-and-segments?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

interests.title: Interests
interests.description: Manage interests for a specific MailChimp list. Assign subscribers to interests to group them together. Interests are referred to as 'group names' in the MailChimp application. [Learn more about using groups in MailChimp](http://kb.mailchimp.com/segments/how-to-use-groups-and-segments?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

list-segments.title: Segments
list-segments.description: Manage segments for a specific MailChimp list. A segment is a section of your list that includes only those subscribers who share specific common field information. [Learn more about segments in MailChimp](http://kb.mailchimp.com/segments/getting-started-with-segments?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

list-member-activity.title: Member Activity
list-member-activity.description: Get details about subscribers' recent activity.

list-member-goal.title: Member Goals
list-member-goal.description: Get information about recent [goal events](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/integrate-goal-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) for a specific list member.

list-member-notes.title: Member Notes
list-member-notes.description: Retrieve recent [notes](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/view-a-subscriber-profile-page?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Notes) for a specific list member.

list-locations.title: Locations
list-locations.description: Get the locations (countries) that the list's subscribers have been tagged to based on geocoding their IP address.

reports.title: Reports
reports.description: Manage campaign reports for your MailChimp account. All Reports endpoints are read-only. MailChimp's campaign and Automation reports analyze clicks, opens, subscribers' social activity, e-commerce data, and more. [Learn more about campaign reports](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-campaign-reports?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

campaign-abuse.title: Campaign Abuse
campaign-abuse.description: Get information about campaign abuse complaints.

campaign-advice.title: Campaign Advice
campaign-advice.description: Get recent feedback based on a campaign's statistics.

open-reports.title: Campaign Open Reports
open-reports.description: Get a detailed report about any emails in a specific campaign that were opened by the recipient. Learn more about [open tracking](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-open-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in MailChimp.

click-reports.title: Click Reports
click-reports.description: Get detailed information about links clicked in campaigns.

link-clickers.title: Click Reports Members
link-clickers.description: Get information about specific subscribers who clicked on links in a campaign.

domain-performance-reports.title: Domain Performance
domain-performance-reports.description: Get  statistics for the top-performing domains from a campaign.

eepurl-reports.title: EepURL Reports
eepurl-reports.description: Get a summary of social activity for the campaign, tracked by [EepURL](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/eepurl-activity-stats?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

email-activity-reports.title: Email Activity
email-activity-reports.description: Get list member activity for a specific campaign.

google-analytics.title: Google Analytics
google-analytics.description: Get a summary of Google Analytics reports for a specific campaign.

location-reports.title: Location
location-reports.description: Get top open locations for a specific campaign.

sub-reports.title: Sub-Reports
sub-reports.description: A list of reports for child campaigns of a specific parent campaign. For example, use this endpoint to view [Multivariate](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/multivariate/about-multivariate-campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs), [RSS](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/rss-in-campaigns/create-an-rss-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs), and [A/B Testing](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/ab/about-ab-testing-campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) Campaign reports.

unsub-reports.title: Unsubscribes
unsub-reports.description: Get information about list members who unsubscribed from a specific campaign.

templates.title: Templates
templates.description: Manage your MailChimp templates. A template is an HTML file used to create the layout and basic design for a campaign. [Learn more about templates](http://kb.mailchimp.com/templates/basic-and-themes/types-of-templates?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

template-default-content.title: Default Content
template-default-content.description: Manage the default content for a MailChimp template.

ecommerce-stores.title: E-commerce Stores
ecommerce-stores.description: Connect your [E-commerce Store](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#stores) to MailChimp to take advantage of powerful reporting and personalization features and to [learn more about your customers](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/e-commerce/how-to-use-mailchimp-for-e-commerce?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

ecommerce-customers.title: Customers
ecommerce-customers.description: Add [Customers](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#customers) to your Store to track their orders and to [view E-Commerce Data](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/e-commerce/review-e-commerce-data?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) for your MailChimp lists and campaigns. Each Customer is connected to a MailChimp list member, so adding a Customer can also [add or update a list member](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#about-subscribers-and-customers).

ecommerce-orders.title: Orders
ecommerce-orders.description: [Orders](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders) represent successful e-commerce transactions, and this data can be used to provide more detailed campaign reports, track sales, and personalize emails to your targeted consumers, and [view other e-commerce data in your MailChimp account](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/e-commerce/review-e-commerce-data?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

ecommerce-order-lines.title: Order Lines
ecommerce-order-lines.description: Each Order contains one or more [Order Lines](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#order-lines), which represent a specific Product Variant that a Customer purchases.

ecommerce-products.title: Products
ecommerce-products.description: E-commerce items for sale in your store need to be created as [Products](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#products) so you can add the items to a Cart or an Order. [Each Product requires at least one Product Variant](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#product-variants).

ecommerce-product-variants.title: Product Variants
ecommerce-product-variants.description: A [Product Variant](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#product-variants) represents a specific item for purchase, and is contained within a parent Product. At least one Product Variant is required for each Product.

ecommerce-product-images.title: Product Images
ecommerce-product-images.description: A [Product Image](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#product-variants) represents a specific product image.

ecommerce-carts.title: Carts
ecommerce-carts.description: Use [Carts](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#carts) to represent unfinished e-commerce transactions. This can be used to create an [Abandoned Cart workflow](http://kb.mailchimp.com/automation/create-an-abandoned-cart-workflow?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs), or to save a consumerâ€™s shopping cart [pending a successful Order](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#about-carts-and-orders).

ecommerce-cart-lines.title: Cart Lines
ecommerce-cart-lines.description: Each Cart contains one or more [Cart Lines](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#cart-lines), which represent a specific Product Variant that a Customer has added to their shopping cart.

search-members.title: Search Members
search-members.description: [Search the account or a specific list for members](http://kb.mailchimp.com/accounts/management/search-for-subscribers-and-campaigns-in-your-account?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) that match the specified query terms.

search-campaigns.title: Search Campaigns
search-campaigns.description: [Search all of an account's campaigns](http://kb.mailchimp.com/accounts/management/search-for-subscribers-and-campaigns-in-your-account?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) for the specified query terms.

ping.title: Ping
ping.description: A health check endpoint for MailChimp API 3.0.

get.summary: API Root
get.description: Get links to all other resources available in the API.

default.description: Error descriptions for the MailChimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the MailChimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

examples.title: Internal Server Error
examples.detail: A deep, internal error has occurred during the processing of your request. Please contact support.

get.summary: Get a list of authorized apps
get.description: Get a list of an account's registered, connected applications.

apps.title: Authorized Applications
apps.description: An array of objects, each representing an authorized application.

id.title: Client ID
id.description: The ID for the application.

description.title: Application Description
description.description: A short description of the application.

users.title: Application Users
users.description: An array of usernames for users who have linked the app.

post.description: Retrieve OAuth2-based credentials to associate API calls with your application.

parameters.name: Client Details
parameters.description: Use this endpoint to link your application and retrieve OAuth2-based credentials. This is useful if you can't implement the OAuth2 flow but still want to associate calls with your application.

client_id.title: Client ID
client_id.description: The client's unique id/username for authorization.

access_token.title: Access Token
access_token.description: The access token issued by the auth server.

viewer_token.title: Viewer Token
viewer_token.description: The viewer token issued by the auth server.

default.description: Error descriptions for the MailChimp API.

users.title: Application Users

get.summary: Get a list of Automations
get.description: Get a summary of an account's Automations.

items.title: Automation Workflow
items.description: A summary of an individual Automation workflow's settings and content.

id.title: Automation Campaign ID
id.description: A string that identifies the Automation.

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: The date and time the Automation was created.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: The date and time the Automation was started.

status.title: Automation Status
status.description: The current status of the Automation.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for the Automation.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique list id.

segment_opts.title: Segment Options
segment_opts.description: An object representing all segmentation options.

saved_segment_id.title: Saved Segment ID
saved_segment_id.description: The id for an existing saved segment.

settings.title: Automation Campaign Settings
settings.description: The settings for the Automation workflow.

title.title: Automation Title
title.description: The title of the Automation.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The 'from' name for the Automation (not an email address).

reply_to.title: Reply To Address
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the Automation.

use_conversation.title: Conversations
use_conversation.description: Whether to use MailChimp's [Conversations](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/set-up-and-use-conversations?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The Automation's custom 'To' name, typically the first name [merge field](http://kb.mailchimp.com/merge-tags/using/getting-started-with-merge-tags?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether MailChimp [authenticated](http://kb.mailchimp.com/delivery/deliverability-research/set-up-mailchimp-authentication?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Whether to automatically append MailChimp's [default footer](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/design/theres-a-gray-footer-added-to-my-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to the Automation.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Whether to automatically inline the CSS included with the Automation content.

tracking.title: Automation Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for the Automation.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-open-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs). Defaults to `true`.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-click-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in the HTML version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-click-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in the plain-text version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics Tracking
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

clicktale.title: ClickTale Analytics Tracking
clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Click-Tale) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

salesforce.title: Salesforce CRM Tracking
salesforce.description: Salesforce tracking options for an Automation. Must be using MailChimp's built-in [Salesforce integration](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/about-mailchimp-for-salesforce?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

campaign.title: Salesforce Campaign
campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

notes.title: Salesforce Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on a subscriber's email address.

capsule.title: Capsule CRM Tracking
capsule.description: Capsule tracking options for an Automation. Must be using MailChimp's built-in [Capsule integration](https://connect.mailchimp.com/integrations/capsule-crm-integration?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

notes.title: Capsule Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on a subscriber's email addresses.

report_summary.title: Campaign Report Summary
report_summary.description: A summary of opens, clicks, and unsubscribes for sent campaigns.

opens.title: Automation Opens
opens.description: The total number of opens for a campaign.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

clicks.title: Total Clicks
clicks.description: The total number of clicks for an campaign.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks, divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

automations.title: Automation Workflows
automations.description: An array of objects, each representing an Automation workflow.

default.description: Error descriptions for the MailChimp API.

parameters.description: The unique id for the Automation workflow.

schema.title: Automation Workflow
schema.description: A summary of an individual Automation workflow's settings and content.

id.title: Automation Campaign ID
id.description: A string that identifies the Automation.

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: The date and time the Automation was created.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: The date and time the Automation was started.

status.title: Automation Status
status.description: The current status of the Automation.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for the Automation.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique list id.

segment_opts.title: Segment Options
segment_opts.description: An object representing all segmentation options.

saved_segment_id.title: Saved Segment ID
saved_segment_id.description: The id for an existing saved segment.

settings.title: Automation Campaign Settings
settings.description: The settings for the Automation workflow.

title.title: Automation Title
title.description: The title of the Automation.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The 'from' name for the Automation (not an email address).

reply_to.title: Reply To Address
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the Automation.

use_conversation.title: Conversations
use_conversation.description: Whether to use MailChimp's [Conversations](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/set-up-and-use-conversations?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The Automation's custom 'To' name, typically the first name [merge field](http://kb.mailchimp.com/merge-tags/using/getting-started-with-merge-tags?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether MailChimp [authenticated](http://kb.mailchimp.com/delivery/deliverability-research/set-up-mailchimp-authentication?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Whether to automatically append MailChimp's [default footer](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/design/theres-a-gray-footer-added-to-my-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to the Automation.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Whether to automatically inline the CSS included with the Automation content.

tracking.title: Automation Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for the Automation.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-open-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs). Defaults to `true`.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-click-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in the HTML version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-click-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in the plain-text version of the Automation. Defaults to `true`.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics Tracking
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

post.summary: Add a subscriber to a workflow email
post.description: Manually add a subscriber to a workflow, bypassing the default trigger settings. You can also use this endpoint to trigger a series of automated emails in an [API 3.0 workflow type](http://kb.mailchimp.com/automation/about-automation-workflow-types?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Using-the-API) or add subscribers to an automated email queue that uses the [API request delay type](http://kb.mailchimp.com/automation/about-automation-workflow-types?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Using-the-API).

default.description: Error descriptions for the MailChimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the MailChimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

examples.title: Internal Server Error
examples.detail: A deep, internal error has occurred during the processing of your request. Please contact support.

get.summary: Get all campaigns
get.description: Get all campaigns in an account.

items.title: Campaign
items.description: A summary of an individual campaign's settings and content.

id.title: Campaign ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this campaign.

web_id.title: Campaign Web ID
web_id.description: The ID used in the MailChimp web application. View this campaign in your MailChimp account at `https://{dc}.admin.mailchimp.com/campaigns/show/?id={web_id}`.

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: The date and time the campaign was created.

archive_url.title: Archive URL
archive_url.description: The link to the campaign's archive version.

long_archive_url.title: Long Archive URL
long_archive_url.description: The original link to the campaign's archive version.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: The date and time a campaign was sent.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: How the campaign's content is put together ('template', 'drag_and_drop', 'html', 'url').

needs_block_refresh.title: Needs Block Refresh
needs_block_refresh.description: Determines if the campaign needs its blocks refreshed by opening the web-based campaign editor.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique list id.

segment_text.title: Segment Text
segment_text.description: A description of the [segment](http://kb.mailchimp.com/segments/how-to-use-groups-and-segments?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) used for the campaign. Formatted as a string marked up with HTML.

recipient_count.title: Recipient Count
recipient_count.description: Count of the recipients on the associated list. Formatted as an integer.

settings.title: Campaign Settings
settings.description: The settings for your campaign, including subject, from name, reply-to address, and more.

subject_line.title: Campaign Subject Line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

preview_text.title: Campaign Preview Text
preview_text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

title.title: Campaign Title
title.description: The title of the campaign.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The 'from' name on the campaign (not an email address).

reply_to.title: Reply To Address
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the campaign.

use_conversation.title: Conversation
use_conversation.description: Use MailChimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The campaign's custom 'To' name. Typically the first name [merge field](http://kb.mailchimp.com/merge-tags/using/getting-started-with-merge-tags?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

folder_id.title: Folder ID
folder_id.description: If the campaign is listed in a folder, the id for that folder.

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether MailChimp [authenticated](http://kb.mailchimp.com/delivery/deliverability-research/set-up-mailchimp-authentication?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) the campaign. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Automatically append MailChimp's [default footer](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/design/theres-a-gray-footer-added-to-my-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to the campaign.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content.

auto_tweet.title: Auto-Tweet
auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the [campaign archive](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/archives/set-up-your-campaign-archive?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) page when the campaign is sent.

auto_fb_post.title: Auto Post to Facebook
auto_fb_post.description: An array of [Facebook](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/facebook/integrate-facebook-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) page ids to auto-post to.

fb_comments.title: Facebook Comments
fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The id for the template used in this campaign.

drag_and_drop.title: Drag And Drop Campaign
drag_and_drop.description: Whether the campaign uses the drag-and-drop editor.

variate_settings.title: A/B Test Options
variate_settings.description: The settings specific to A/B test campaigns.

winning_campaign_id.title: Winning Campaign ID
winning_campaign_id.description: ID of the campaign that was sent to the remaining recipients based on the winning combination.

winner_criteria.title: Winning Criteria
winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenueâ€”or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the MailChimp web application.

wait_time.title: Wait Time
wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.

test_size.title: Test Size

default.description: Error descriptions for the MailChimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the MailChimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

examples.title: Internal Server Error
examples.detail: A deep, internal error has occurred during the processing of your request. Please contact support.

subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenueâ€”or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the MailChimp web application.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Automatically append MailChimp's [default footer](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/design/theres-a-gray-footer-added-to-my-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to the campaign.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content.

auto_tweet.title: Auto-Tweet
auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the [campaign archive](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/archives/set-up-your-campaign-archive?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) page when the campaign is sent.

auto_fb_post.title: Auto Post to Facebook
auto_fb_post.description: An array of [Facebook](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/facebook/integrate-facebook-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) page ids to auto-post to.

fb_comments.title: Facebook Comments
fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The id of the template to use.

variate_settings.title: A/B Test Options
variate_settings.description: The settings specific to A/B test campaigns.

winner_criteria.title: Winning Criteria
winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenueâ€”or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the MailChimp web application.

wait_time.title: Wait Time
wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.

test_size.title: Test Size
test_size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.

subject_lines.title: Subject Lines
subject_lines.description: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.

send_times.title: Send Times
send_times.description: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored.

from_names.title: From Names
from_names.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.

reply_to_addresses.title: Reply To Addresses
reply_to_addresses.description: The possible reply-to addresses. The number of reply_to_addresses provided must match the number of from_names. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.

combinations.title: Combinations
combinations.description: Combinations of possible variables used to build emails.

id.title: ID
id.description: Unique ID for the combination.

subject_line.title: Subject Line
subject_line.description: The index of `variate_settings.subject_lines` used.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The index of `variate_settings.from_names` used.

recipients.title: Recipients
recipients.description: The number of recipients for this combination.

default.description: Error descriptions for the MailChimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the MailChimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

examples.title: Internal Server Error
examples.detail: A deep, internal error has occurred during the processing of your request. Please contact support.

delete.description: Remove a campaign from your MailChimp account.

post.description: [Schedule a campaign](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/confirmation-and-sending/schedule-pause-or-send-a-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) for delivery. If you're using [Multivariate Campaigns](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/multivariate/about-multivariate-campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to test send times or sending [RSS Campaigns](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/rss-in-campaigns/create-an-rss-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs), use the [send](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/reference/campaigns/#action-post_campaigns_campaign_id_actions_send) action instead.

schedule_time.title: Schedule Time
schedule_time.description: The date and time in UTC to schedule the campaign for delivery. Campaigns may only be scheduled to send on the quarter-hour (:00, :15, :30, :45).

timewarp.title: Timewarp
timewarp.description: Choose whether the campaign should use [Timewarp](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/confirmation-and-sending/use-timewarp-to-optimize-sending-by-time-zone?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) when sending. Campaigns scheduled with Timewarp are localized based on the recipients' time zones. For example, a Timewarp campaign with a `schedule_time` of 13:00 will be sent to each recipient at 1:00pm in their local time. Cannot be set to `true` for campaigns using [Batch Delivery](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/confirmation-and-sending/schedule-batch-delivery?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

batch_delivery.title: Batch Delivery
batch_delivery.description: Choose whether the campaign should use [Batch Delivery](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/confirmation-and-sending/schedule-batch-delivery?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs). Cannot be set to `true` for campaigns using [Timewarp](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/confirmation-and-sending/use-timewarp-to-optimize-sending-by-time-zone?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

batch_delay.title: Batch Delay
batch_delay.description: The delay, in minutes, between batches.

batch_count.title: Batch Count
batch_count.description: The number of batches for the campaign send.

get.summary: Get campaign content
get.description: Get the the HTML and plain-text content for a campaign.

schema.title: Campaign Content
schema.description: The HTML and plain-text content for a campaign.

content_label.title: Content Label
content_label.description: Label used to identify the content option.

plain_text.title: Plain Text
plain_text.description: The plain-text portion of the campaign. If left unspecified, we'll generate this automatically.
plain_text.example: Freddie likes jokes. Go to http://freddiesjokes.com to see all his jokes.

html.title: Campaign HTML
html.description: The raw HTML for the campaign.
html.example: <!DOCTYPE html><html xmlns=http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml><head><meta http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"><title>*|MC:SUBJECT|*</title><style type=text/css>body{background-color:#d0e4fe}</style><body leftmargin=0 marginwidth=0 topmargin=0 marginheight=0 offset=0>

schema.title: Campaign Content

plain_text.title: Plain Text
plain_text.description: The plain-text portion of the campaign. If left unspecified, we'll generate this automatically.

html.description: The raw HTML for the campaign.

url.title: Campaign URL
url.description: When importing a campaign, the URL where the HTML lives.

template.title: Template Content
template.description: Use this template to generate the HTML content of the campaign

id.title: Template ID
id.description: The id of the template to use.

sections.title: Template Sections
sections.description: Content for the sections of the template. Each key should be the unique [mc:edit area](http://kb.mailchimp.com/templates/code/create-editable-content-areas-with-mailchimps-template-language?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) name from the template.

archive.title: Upload Archive
archive.description: Available when uploading an archive to create campaign content. The archive should include all campaign content and images. [Learn more](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/ways-to-build/import-a-zip-file-to-create-a-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

archive_content.title: Archive Content
archive_content.description: The base64-encoded representation of the archive file.

archive_type.title: Archive Type
archive_type.description: The type of encoded file. Defaults to zip.

variate_contents.title: Variate Contents
variate_contents.description: Content options for [Multivariate Campaigns](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/multivariate/about-multivariate-campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs). Each content option must provide HTML content and may optionally provide plain text. For campaigns not testing content, only one object should be provided.

content_label.title: Content Label
content_label.description: The label used to identify the content option.

plain_text.title: Plain Text
plain_text.description: The plain-text portion of the campaign. If left unspecified, we'll generate this automatically.

html.title: Campaign HTML
html.description: The raw HTML for the campaign.

url.title: Campaign URL
url.description: When importing a campaign, the URL for the HTML.

template.title: Template Content
template.description: Use this template to generate the HTML content for the campaign.

id.title: Template ID
id.description: The id of the template to use.

sections.title: Template Sections
sections.description: Content for the sections of the template. Each key should be the unique [mc:edit area](http://kb.mailchimp.com/templates/code/create-editable-content-areas-with-mailchimps-template-language?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) name from the template.

merge_field_count.title: Merge Var Count

from_name.description: The default from name for campaigns sent to this list.

from_email.title: Sender's Email Address
from_email.description: The default from email for campaigns sent to this list.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: The default subject line for campaigns sent to this list.

language.title: Language
language.description: The default language for this lists's forms.

notify_on_subscribe.title: Notify on Subscribe
notify_on_subscribe.description: The email address to send [subscribe notifications](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/change-subscribe-and-unsubscribe-notifications?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to.

notify_on_unsubscribe.title: Notify on Unsubscribe
notify_on_unsubscribe.description: The email address to send [unsubscribe notifications](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/change-subscribe-and-unsubscribe-notifications?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to.

email_type_option.title: Email Type Option
email_type_option.description: Whether the list supports [multiple formats for emails](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/growth/how-to-change-list-name-and-defaults?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Change-Subscription-Settings). When set to `true`, subscribers can choose whether they want to receive HTML or plain-text emails. When set to `false`, subscribers will receive HTML emails, with a plain-text alternative backup.

visibility.title: Visibility
visibility.description: Whether this list is [public or private](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/growth/about-publicity-settings?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

schema.title: Subscriber List
schema.description: Information about a specific list.

id.title: List ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this list.

web_id.title: List Web ID
web_id.description: The ID used in the MailChimp web application. View this list in your MailChimp account at `https://{dc}.admin.mailchimp.com/lists/members/?id={web_id}`.

contact.title: List Contact
contact.description: [Contact information displayed in campaign footers](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/growth/about-the-required-email-footer-content?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to comply with international spam laws.

company.title: Company Name
company.description: The company name for the list.

address1.title: Address
address1.description: The street address for the list contact.

address2.title: Address
address2.description: The street address for the list contact.

city.title: City
city.description: The city for the list contact.

state.title: State
state.description: The state for the list contact.

zip.title: Postal Code
zip.description: The postal or zip code for the list contact.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: A two-character ISO3166 country code. Defaults to US if invalid.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the list contact.

use_archive_bar.title: Use Archive Bar
use_archive_bar.description: Whether campaigns for this list use the [Archive Bar](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/archives/about-the-archive-bar?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in archives by default.

campaign_defaults.title: Campaign Defaults
campaign_defaults.description: [Default values for campaigns](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/design/set-up-email-subject-from-name-and-from-email-address-on-a-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) created for this list.

from_name.title: Sender's Name
from_name.description: The default from name for campaigns sent to this list.

from_email.title: Sender's Email Address
from_email.description: The default from email for campaigns sent to this list.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: The default subject line for campaigns sent to this list.

language.title: Language
language.description: The default language for this lists's forms.

notify_on_subscribe.title: Notify on Subscribe
notify_on_subscribe.description: The email address to send [subscribe notifications](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/change-subscribe-and-unsubscribe-notifications?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to.

notify_on_unsubscribe.title: Notify on Unsubscribe
notify_on_unsubscribe.description: The email address to send [unsubscribe notifications](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/managing-subscribers/change-subscribe-and-unsubscribe-notifications?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to.

date_created.title: Creation Date
date_created.description: The date and time that this list was created.

list_rating.title: List Rating
list_rating.description: An auto-generated activity score for the list (0-5).

email_type_option.title: Email Type Option
email_type_option.description: Whether the list supports [multiple formats for emails](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/growth/how-to-change-list-name-and-defaults?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Change-Subscription-Settings). When set to `true`, subscribers can choose whether they want to receive HTML or plain-text emails. When set to `false`, subscribers will receive HTML emails, with a plain-text alternative backup.

subscribe_url_short.title: Subscribe URL Short
subscribe_url_short.description: Our [EepURL shortened](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/signup-forms/share-your-signup-form?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Signup-Form-URL) version of this list's subscribe form.

subscribe_url_long.title: Subscribe URL Long
subscribe_url_long.description: The full version of this list's subscribe form (host will vary).

visibility.title: Visibility
visibility.description: Whether this list is [public or private](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/growth/about-publicity-settings?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

modules.title: Modules
modules.description: Any list-specific modules installed for this list.

stats.title: Statistics
stats.description: Stats for the list. Many of these are cached for at least five minutes.

member_count.title: Member Count
member_count.description: The number of active members in the list.

unsubscribe_count.title: Unsubscribe Count
unsubscribe_count.description: The number of members who have unsubscribed from the list.

cleaned_count.title: Cleaned Count
cleaned_count.description: The number of members cleaned from the list.

member_count_since_send.title: Member Count Since Send
member_count_since_send.description: The number of active members in the list since the last campaign was sent.

unsubscribe_count_since_send.title: Unsubscribe Count Since Send
unsubscribe_count_since_send.description: The number of members who have unsubscribed since the last campaign was sent.

cleaned_count_since_send.title: Cleaned Count Since Send
cleaned_count_since_send.description: The number of members cleaned from the list since the last campaign was sent.

campaign_count.title: Campaign Count
campaign_count.description: The number of campaigns in any status that use this list.

campaign_last_sent.title: Campaign Last Sent
campaign_last_sent.description: The date and time the last campaign was sent to this list. This is updated when a campaign is sent to 10 or more recipients.

merge_field_count.title: Merge Var Count
merge_field_count.description: The number of merge vars for this list (not EMAIL, which is required).

avg_sub_rate.title: Average Subscription Rate
avg_sub_rate.description: The average number of subscriptions per month for the list (not returned if we haven't calculated it yet).

avg_unsub_rate.title: Average Unsubscription Rate
avg_unsub_rate.description: The average number of unsubscriptions per month for the list (not returned if we haven't calculated it yet).

target_sub_rate.title: Average Subscription Rate
target_sub_rate.description: The target number of subscriptions per month for the list to keep it growing (not returned if we haven't calculated it yet).

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The average open rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list (not returned if we haven't calculated it yet).

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The average click rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list (not returned if we haven't calculated it yet).

last_sub_date.title: Date of Last List Subscribe
last_sub_date.description: The date and time of the last time someone subscribed to this list.

last_unsub_date.title: Date of Last List Unsubscribe
last_unsub_date.description: The date and time of the last time someone unsubscribed from this list.

email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').

status.description: Subscriber's current status.

merge_fields.description: An individual merge var and value for a member.

additionalProperties.description: Keys are interest IDs, values are booleans that describe whether the list member is in that group or not.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The location latitude.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The location longitude.

gmtoff.title: GMT Offset
gmtoff.description: The time difference in hours from GMT.

dstoff.title: DST Offset

timestamp_signup.description: The date and time the subscriber signed up for the list.

ip_opt.description: The IP address the subscriber used to confirm their opt-in status.

timestamp_opt.title: Opt-in Timestamp
timestamp_opt.description: The date and time the subscribe confirmed their opt-in status.

total_updated.description: The total number of items matching the query, irrespective of pagination.

emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.

abuse_reports.description: The number of abuse reports generated for this campaign.

rss_last_send.description: For RSS campaigns, the date and time of the last send

get.summary: Get reports for child campaigns
get.description: Get a list of reports with child campaigns for a specific parent campaign.

schema.title: Campaign Sub-Reports
schema.description: A list of reports containing child campaigns for a specific campaign.

items.title: Campaign Report
items.description: Report details about a sent campaign.

id.title: Campaign ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this campaign.

type.title: Campaign Type
type.description: The type of campaign (regular, plain-text, ab_split, rss, automation, variate, or auto).

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique list id.

subject_line.title: Campaign Subject Line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

preview_text.title: Campaign Preview Text
preview_text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.

abuse_reports.title: Abuse Reports
abuse_reports.description: The number of abuse reports generated for this campaign.

unsubscribed.title: Unsubscribe Count
unsubscribed.description: The total number of unsubscribed members for this campaign.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: The date and time a campaign was sent.

rss_last_send.title: RSS Last Send
rss_last_send.description: For RSS campaigns, the date and time of the last send

bounces.title: Bounces
bounces.description: An object describing the bounce summary for the campaign.

hard_bounces.title: Hard Bounces
hard_bounces.description: The total number of hard bounced email addresses.

soft_bounces.title: Soft Bounces
soft_bounces.description: The total number of soft bounced email addresses.

syntax_errors.title: Syntax Errors
syntax_errors.description: The total number of addresses that were syntax-related bounces.

forwards.title: Forwards
forwards.description: An object describing the forwards and forward activity for the campaign.

forwards_count.title: Total Forwards
forwards_count.description: How many times the campaign has been forwarded.

forwards_opens.title: Forward Opens
forwards_opens.description: How many times the forwarded campaign has been opened.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: An object describing the open activity for the campaign.

opens_total.title: Total Opens
opens_total.description: The total number of opens for a campaign.

unique_opens.title: Unique Opens
unique_opens.description: The total number of unique opens.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

last_open.title: Last Open
last_open.description: The date and time of the last recorded open.

clicks.title: Clicks
clicks.description: An object describing the click activity for the campaign.

clicks_total.title: Total Clicks
clicks_total.description: The total number of clicks for the campaign.

unique_clicks.title: Unique Clicks
unique_clicks.description: The total number of unique clicks for links across a campaign.

unique_subscriber_clicks.title: Unique Subscriber Clicks
unique_subscriber_clicks.description: The total number of subscribers who clicked on a campaign.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

last_click.title: Last Click
last_click.description: The date and time of the last recorded click for the campaign.

facebook_likes.title: Facebook Likes
facebook_likes.description: An object describing campaign engagement on Facebook.

recipient_likes.title: Recipient Likes
recipient_likes.description: The number of recipients who liked the campaign on Facebook.

facebook_likes.title: Facebook Likes
facebook_likes.description: The number of Facebook likes for the campaign.

industry_stats.title: Industry Stats
industry_stats.description: The average campaign statistics for your industry.

type.title: Industry Type
type.description: The type of business industry associated with your account. For example: retail, education, etc.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The industry open rate.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The industry click rate.

list_stats.title: Industry Stats
list_stats.description: The average campaign statistics for your industry. This won't be present if we haven't calculated it yet for this list.

sub_rate.title: Average Subscription Rate
sub_rate.description: The average number of subscriptions per month for the list.

unsub_rate.title: Average Unsubscription Rate
unsub_rate.description: The average number of unsubscriptions per month for the list.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The average open rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The average click rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list.

ab_split.title: A/B Split Stats
ab_split.description: General stats about different groups of an A/B Split campaign. Does not return information about [MailChimp Pro's Multivariate Campaigns](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/multivariate/about-multivariate-campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

forwards_opens.title: Forward Opens
forwards_opens.description: Opens from forwards for Campaign A.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Opens for Campaign A.

last_open.title: Last Open
last_open.description: The last open for Campaign A.

forwards_opens.title: Forward Opens
forwards_opens.description: Opens for forwards from Campaign B.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Opens for Campaign B.

last_open.title: Last Open
last_open.description: The last open for Campaign B.

timewarp.title: Timewarp Stats
timewarp.description: An hourly breakdown of sends, opens, and clicks if a campaign is sent using timewarp.

gmt_offset.title: GMT Offset
gmt_offset.description: For campaigns sent with timewarp, the time zone group the member is apart of.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: The number of opens.

last_open.title: Last Open
last_open.description: The date and time of the last open.

clicks.title: Clicks
clicks.description: The number of clicks.

last_click.title: Last Click
last_click.description: The date and time of the last click.

timeseries.title: Timeseries
timeseries.description: An hourly breakdown of the performance of the campaign over the first 24 hours.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The date and time for the series.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The number of emails sent in the timeseries.

unique_opens.title: Unique Opens
unique_opens.description: The number of unique opens in the timeseries.

recipients_clicks.title: Recipient Clicks
recipients_clicks.description: The number of clicks in the timeseries.

share_report.title: Share Report
share_report.description: The url and password for the [VIP report](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/email-a-report-to-a-client?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

share_url.title: Report URL
share_url.description: The URL for the VIP report.

share_password.title: Report Password
share_password.description: If password protected, the password for the VIP report.

total_orders.title: Total Orders
total_orders.description: The total orders for a campaign.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total spent for a campaign. Calculated as the sum of all order totals with no deductions.

total_revenue.title: Total Revenue
total_revenue.description: The total revenue for a campaign. Calculated as the sum of all order totals minus shipping and tax totals.

reports.title: Reports
reports.description: An array of objects, each representing a report resource.

campaign_id.title: Campaign ID
campaign_id.description: Unique identifier of the parent campaign

schema.title: Template Instance
schema.description: Information about a specific template.

folder_id.title: Folder ID
folder_id.description: The id of the folder the template is currently in.

html.title: Template HTML
html.description: The raw HTML for the template. We  support the MailChimp [Template Language](http://kb.mailchimp.com/templates/code/getting-started-with-mailchimps-template-language?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in any HTML code passed via the API.

schema.title: Template Instance
schema.description: Information about a specific template.

id.title: Template ID
id.description: The individual id for the template.

type.title: Template Type
type.description: The type of template (user, base, or gallery).

drag_and_drop.title: Drag and Drop
drag_and_drop.description: Whether the template uses the drag and drop editor.

responsive.title: Responsive
responsive.description: Whether the template contains media queries to make it responsive.

category.title: Template Category
category.description: If available, the category the template is listed in.

date_created.title: Date Created
date_created.description: The date and time the template was created.

created_by.title: Created By
created_by.description: The login name for template's creator.

active.title: Active
active.description: User templates are not 'deleted,' but rather marked as 'inactive.' Returns whether the template is still active.

folder_id.title: Folder ID
folder_id.description: The id of the folder the template is currently in.

thumbnail.title: Template Thumbnail
thumbnail.description: If available, the URL for a thumbnail of the template.

get.summary: Get information about an account's orders
get.description: Get information about an account's orders.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.title: Customer ID
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders made by a specific customer.

parameters.name: has_outreach
parameters.title: Has Outreach
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders that have an outreach attached. For example, an email campaign or Facebook ad.

schema.title: Orders
schema.description: A collection of orders in an account.

orders.title: Orders
orders.description: An array of objects, each representing an order resource.

items.title: E-commerce Order
items.description: Information about a specific order.

id.title: Order Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the order.

customer.title: E-commerce Customer
customer.description: Information about a specific customer. Orders for existing customers should include only the `id` parameter in the `customer` object body.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing MailChimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your MailChimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#about-subscribers-and-customers).

company.title: Company
company.description: The customer's company.

orders_count.title: Orders Count
orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.title: Province
province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

created_at.title: Creation Time
created_at.description: The date and time the customer was created.

updated_at.title: Update Time
updated_at.description: The date and time the customer was last updated.

store_id.title: Store Foreign ID
store_id.description: The unique identifier for the store.

campaign_id.title: Campaign ID
campaign_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the campaign associated with an order.

landing_site.title: Landing Site
landing_site.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop.

financial_status.title: Financial Status
financial_status.description: The order status. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#order-status-notifications).

fulfillment_status.title: Fulfillment Status
fulfillment_status.description: The fulfillment status for the order. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#order-status-notifications).

currency_code.title: Currency Code
currency_code.description: The three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code for the currency that the store accepts.

order_total.title: Order Total
order_total.description: The order total associated with an order.

discount_total.title: Discount Total
discount_total.description: The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price of the order.

tax_total.title: Tax Total
tax_total.description: The tax total associated with an order.

shipping_total.title: Shipping Total
shipping_total.description: The shipping total for the order.

tracking_code.title: Tracking Code
tracking_code.description: The MailChimp tracking code for the order. Uses the 'mc_tc' parameter in E-Commerce tracking URLs.

processed_at_foreign.title: Foreign Processed Time
processed_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was processed.

cancelled_at_foreign.title: Foreign Cancel Time
cancelled_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was cancelled.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was updated.

shipping_address.title: Shipping Address
shipping_address.description: The shipping address for the order.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name associated with an order's shipping address.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The shipping address for the order.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the shipping address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city in the order's shipping address.

province.title: Province
province.description: The state or normalized province in the order's shipping address.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the province or state the order's shipping address is located in.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal or zip code in the order's shipping address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The country in the order's shipping address.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the country in the shipping address.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude for the shipping address location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude for the shipping address location.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the order's shipping address

company.title: Company
company.description: The company associated with an order's shipping address.

billing_address.title: Billing Address
billing_address.description: The billing address for the order.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name associated with an order's billing address.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The billing address for the order.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the billing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city in the billing address.

province.title: Province
province.description: The state or normalized province in the billing address.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the province or state in the billing address.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal or zip code in the billing address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The country in the billing address.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the country in the billing address.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude for the billing address location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude for the billing address location.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the billing address.

company.title: Company
company.description: The company associated with the billing address.

lines.title: Order Line Items
lines.description: An array of the order's line items.

items.title: E-commerce Order Line Item
items.description: Information about a specific order line.

id.title: Order Line Item Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the order line item.

product_id.title: Order Line Item Product Foreign ID
product_id.description: A unique identifier for the product associated with the order line item.

product_title.title: Order Line Item Product Title
product_title.description: The name of the product for the order line item.

product_variant_id.title: Order Line Item Product Variant Foreign ID
product_variant_id.description: A unique identifier for the product variant associated with the order line item.

product_variant_title.title: Order Line Item Product Variant Title
product_variant_title.description: The name of the product variant for the order line item.

image_url.title: Product Image URL
image_url.description: The image URL for a product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The quantity of an order line item.

price.title: Price
price.description: The price of an order line item.

discount.title: Discount
discount.description: The total discount amount applied to this line item.

outreach.title: Outreach
outreach.description: The outreach associated with this order. For example, an email campaign or Facebook ad.

id.title: Outreach ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the outreach. Can be an email campaign ID.

published_time.title: Outreach published time
published_time.description: The date and time the Outreach was published

get.summary: Get information about all stores

schema.description: A collection of stores in the account.

items.description: An individual store in an account.

id.description: The unique identifier for the store.

list_id.description: The unique identifier for the [MailChimp List](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/reference/lists/) that's associated with the store. The `list_id` for a specific store can't change.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: The e-commerce platform of the store.

is_syncing.title: Is Syncing
is_syncing.description: Whether the e-commerce store is currently [syncing](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#syncing-an-e-commerce-store).

email_address.title: Email Address
email_address.description: The email address for the store.

currency_code.title: Currency
currency_code.description: The three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code for the currency that the store accepts.

money_format.title: Money Format
money_format.description: The currency format for the store. For example: `$`, `Â£`, etc.

primary_locale.title: Primary Locale
primary_locale.description: The primary locale for the store. For example: `en`, `de`, etc.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: The store phone number.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The store's mailing address.

address2.title: Address Field 2

province_code.description: The two-letter code for the store's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The store's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for to the store's country.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude of the store location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude of the store location.

site_foreign_id.description: The unique identifier for the connected site.
