get.summary: Get information about a store's carts
get.description: Get information about a store's carts.

schema.title: Carts
schema.description: A collection of a store's carts.

carts.title: E-commerce Store Carts
carts.description: An array of objects, each representing a cart.

items.title: E-commerce Cart
items.description: Information about a specific cart.

id.title: Cart Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the cart.

customer.title: E-commerce Customer
customer.description: Information about a specific customer. Orders for existing customers should include only the `id` parameter in the `customer` object body.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing MailChimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your MailChimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#about-subscribers-and-customers).

company.title: Company
company.description: The customer's company.

orders_count.title: Orders Count
orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.title: Province
province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

created_at.title: Creation Time
created_at.description: The date and time the customer was created.

updated_at.title: Update Time
updated_at.description: The date and time the customer was last updated.

campaign_id.title: Campaign ID
campaign_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the campaign associated with a cart.

checkout_url.title: Checkout URL
checkout_url.description: The URL for the cart. This parameter is required for [Abandoned Cart](http://kb.mailchimp.com/automation/create-an-abandoned-cart-email) automations.

currency_code.title: Currency Code
currency_code.description: The three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code for the currency that the cart uses.

order_total.title: Order Total
order_total.description: The order total for the cart.

tax_total.title: Tax Total
tax_total.description: The total tax for the cart.

lines.title: Cart Line Items
lines.description: An array of the cart's line items.

items.title: E-commerce Cart Line Item
items.description: Information about a specific cart line item.

id.title: Cart Line Item Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the cart line item.

product_id.title: Cart Line Product Foreign ID
product_id.description: A unique identifier for the product associated with the cart line item.

product_title.title: Cart Line Product Title
product_title.description: The name of the product for the cart line item.

product_variant_id.title: Cart Line Product Variant Foreign ID
product_variant_id.description: A unique identifier for the product variant associated with the cart line item.

product_variant_title.title: Cart Line Product Variant Title
product_variant_title.description: The name of the product variant for the cart line item.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The quantity of a cart line item.

price.title: Price
price.description: The price of a cart line item.

created_at.title: Creation Time
created_at.description: The date and time the cart was created.

updated_at.title: Update Time
updated_at.description: The date and time the cart was last updated.

get.summary: Get information about a store's promo rules
get.description: Get information about a store's promo rules.

schema.title: Promo Rules
schema.description: A collection of the store's promo rules.

promo_rules.title: Promo Rules
promo_rules.description: An array of objects, each representing promo rules defined for a store.

items.title: E-commerce Promo Rule
items.description: Information about an Ecommerce Store's specific Promo Rule

id.title: Promo Rule Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the promo rule. If Ecommerce platform does not support promo rule, use promo code id as promo rule id. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 50.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title that will show up in promotion campaign. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 100.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of a promotion restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 255.
description.example: Save BIG during our summer sale!

starts_at.title: Promo Start Time
starts_at.description: The date and time when the promotion is in effect in ISO 8601 format.

ends_at.title: End Time
ends_at.description: The date and time when the promotion ends. Must be after starts_at and in ISO 8601 format.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The amount of the promo code discount. If 'type' is 'fixed', the amount is treated as a monetary value. If 'type' is 'percentage', amount must be a decimal value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of discount. For free shipping set type to fixed.

target.title: Target
target.description: The target that the discount applies to.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the promo rule is currently enabled.

created_at_foreign.title: Foreign Create Time
created_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was updated in ISO 8601 format.

patch.summary: Update a promo rule. Please note, when a promo rule is updated, the new property/properties will apply to all the promo codes that share this promo_rule_id.
patch.description: Update a promo rule.

schema.title: E-commerce Promo Rule
schema.description: Information about an Ecommerce Store's specific Promo Rule.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title that will show up in promotion campaign. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 100.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of a promotion restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 255.
description.example: Save BIG during our summer sale!

starts_at.title: Promo Start Time
starts_at.description: The date and time when the promotion is in effect in ISO 8601 format.

ends_at.title: End Time
ends_at.description: The date and time when the promotion ends. Must be after starts_at and in ISO 8601 format.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The amount of the promo code discount. If 'type' is 'fixed', the amount is treated as a monetary value. If 'type' is 'percentage', amount must be a decimal value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of discount. For free shipping set type to fixed.

target.title: Target
target.description: The target that the discount applies to.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the promo rule is currently enabled.

created_at_foreign.title: Foreign Create Time
created_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was updated in ISO 8601 format.

schema.title: E-commerce Promo Rule
schema.description: Information about an Ecommerce Store's specific Promo Rule

id.title: Promo Rule Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the promo rule. If Ecommerce platform does not support promo rule, use promo code id as promo rule id. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 50.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title that will show up in promotion campaign. Restricted to UTF-8 characters with max length 100.

description.title: Description

ends_at.title: End Time

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The amount of the promo code discount. If 'type' is 'fixed', the amount is treated as a monetary value. If 'type' is 'percentage', amount must be a decimal value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of discount. For free shipping set type to fixed.

target.title: Target
target.description: The target that the discount applies to.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether the promo rule is currently enabled.

created_at_foreign.title: Foreign Create Time
created_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the promotion was updated in ISO 8601 format.

default.description: Error descriptions for the MailChimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the MailChimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

examples.title: Internal Server Error
examples.detail: A deep, internal error has occurred during the processing of your request. Please contact support.

delete.summary: Delete a promo rule. Please note that when a promo rule is deleted, all the promo codes that share the deleted promo rule's id will be deleted.
delete.description: Delete a promo rule from a store.

get.summary: Get information about a store's orders
get.description: Get information about a store's orders.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.title: Customer ID
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders made by a specific customer.

parameters.name: has_outreach
parameters.title: Has Outreach
parameters.description: Restrict results to orders that have an outreach attached. For example, an email campaign or Facebook ad.

schema.title: Orders
schema.description: A collection of orders in a store.

store_id.title: Store ID
store_id.description: The unique identifier for the store.

orders.title: Orders
orders.description: An array of objects, each representing an order in a store.

items.title: E-commerce Order
items.description: Information about a specific order.

id.title: Order Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the order.

customer.title: E-commerce Customer
customer.description: Information about a specific customer. Orders for existing customers should include only the `id` parameter in the `customer` object body.

id.title: Customer Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the customer.

opt_in_status.title: Opt-in Status
opt_in_status.description: The customer's opt-in status. This value will never overwrite the opt-in status of a pre-existing MailChimp list member, but will apply to list members that are added through the e-commerce API endpoints. Customers who don't opt in to your MailChimp list [will be added as `Transactional` members](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#about-subscribers-and-customers).

company.title: Company
company.description: The customer's company.

orders_count.title: Orders Count
orders_count.description: The customer's total order count. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total amount the customer has spent. [Learn More](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#orders-count-and-total-spent) about using this data.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The mailing address of the customer.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city the customer is located in.

province.title: Province
province.description: The customer's state name or normalized province.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's province or state.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The customer's postal or zip code.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the customer's country.

created_at.title: Creation Time
created_at.description: The date and time the customer was created.

updated_at.title: Update Time
updated_at.description: The date and time the customer was last updated.

store_id.title: Store Foreign ID
store_id.description: The unique identifier for the store.

campaign_id.title: Campaign ID
campaign_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the campaign associated with an order.

landing_site.title: Landing Site
landing_site.description: The URL for the page where the buyer landed when entering the shop.

financial_status.title: Financial Status
financial_status.description: The order status. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#order-status-notifications).

fulfillment_status.title: Fulfillment Status
fulfillment_status.description: The fulfillment status for the order. Use this parameter to trigger [Order Notifications](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/getting-started-with-ecommerce/#order-status-notifications).

currency_code.title: Currency Code
currency_code.description: The three-letter [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) code for the currency that the store accepts.

order_total.title: Order Total
order_total.description: The order total associated with an order.

discount_total.title: Discount Total
discount_total.description: The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price of the order.

tax_total.title: Tax Total
tax_total.description: The tax total associated with an order.

shipping_total.title: Shipping Total
shipping_total.description: The shipping total for the order.

tracking_code.title: Tracking Code
tracking_code.description: The MailChimp tracking code for the order. Uses the 'mc_tc' parameter in E-Commerce tracking URLs.

processed_at_foreign.title: Foreign Processed Time
processed_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was processed.

cancelled_at_foreign.title: Foreign Cancel Time
cancelled_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was cancelled.

updated_at_foreign.title: Foreign Update Time
updated_at_foreign.description: The date and time the order was updated.

shipping_address.title: Shipping Address
shipping_address.description: The shipping address for the order.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name associated with an order's shipping address.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The shipping address for the order.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the shipping address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city in the order's shipping address.

province.title: Province
province.description: The state or normalized province in the order's shipping address.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the province or state the order's shipping address is located in.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal or zip code in the order's shipping address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The country in the order's shipping address.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the country in the shipping address.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude for the shipping address location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude for the shipping address location.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the order's shipping address

company.title: Company
company.description: The company associated with an order's shipping address.

billing_address.title: Billing Address
billing_address.description: The billing address for the order.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name associated with an order's billing address.

address1.title: Address Field 1
address1.description: The billing address for the order.

address2.title: Address Field 2
address2.description: An additional field for the billing address.

city.title: City
city.description: The city in the billing address.

province.title: Province
province.description: The state or normalized province in the billing address.

province_code.title: Province Code
province_code.description: The two-letter code for the province or state in the billing address.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal or zip code in the billing address.

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The country in the billing address.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-letter code for the country in the billing address.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude for the billing address location.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude for the billing address location.

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: The phone number for the billing address.

company.title: Company
company.description: The company associated with the billing address.

lines.title: Order Line Items
lines.description: An array of the order's line items.

items.title: E-commerce Order Line Item
items.description: Information about a specific order line.

id.title: Order Line Item Foreign ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the order line item.

product_id.title: Order Line Item Product Foreign ID
product_id.description: A unique identifier for the product associated with the order line item.

product_title.title: Order Line Item Product Title
product_title.description: The name of the product for the order line item.

product_variant_id.title: Order Line Item Product Variant Foreign ID
product_variant_id.description: A unique identifier for the product variant associated with the order line item.

product_variant_title.title: Order Line Item Product Variant Title
product_variant_title.description: The name of the product variant for the order line item.

image_url.title: Product Image URL
image_url.description: The image URL for a product.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The quantity of an order line item.

price.title: Price
price.description: The price of an order line item.

discount.title: Discount
discount.description: The total discount amount applied to this line item.

outreach.title: Outreach
outreach.description: The outreach associated with this order. For example, an email campaign or Facebook ad.

id.title: Outreach ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the outreach. Can be an email campaign ID.

published_time.title: Outreach published time
published_time.description: The date and time the Outreach was published

schema.title: Problem Detail Document

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title

status.title: HTTP Status Code

detail.title: Error Message

instance.title: Instance ID

examples.title: Internal Server Error

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the MailChimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](http://developer.mailchimp.com/documentation/mailchimp/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

examples.title: Internal Server Error
examples.detail: A deep, internal error has occurred during the processing of your request. Please contact support.

get.summary: Search Members
get.description: Search for list members. This search can be restricted to a specific list, or can be used to search across all lists in an account.

schema.title: Members
schema.description: Members found for given search term

exact_matches.description: Exact matches of the provided search query.
exact_matches.title: Exact Matches

items.title: List Members
items.description: Individuals who are currently or have been previously subscribed to this list, including members who have bounced or unsubscribed.

id.title: Email ID
id.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address.

unique_email_id.title: Unique Email ID
unique_email_id.description: An identifier for the address across all of MailChimp.

email_type.title: Email Type
email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').

status.title: Status
status.description: Subscriber's current status.

merge_fields.title: Member Merge Var
merge_fields.description: An individual merge var and value for a member.

additionalProperties.description: This object's keys are merge tags (like FNAME). It's values are the values to be added to the merge field.

interests.title: Subscriber Interests
interests.description: The key of this object's properties is the ID of the interest in question.

additionalProperties.description: Keys are interest IDs, values are booleans that describe whether the list member is in that group or not.

timestamp_opt.title: Opt-in Timestamp

member_rating.title: Member Rating
member_rating.description: Star rating for this member, between 1 and 5.

latitude.title: Latitude

longitude.title: Longitude

country_code.title: Country Code

last_note.title: Notes

created_at.title: Created Time

created_by.title: Author

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The list id.

members.title: Members

full_search.description: Partial matches of the provided search query.

get.summary: Search Campaigns
get.description: Search all campaigns for the specified query terms.

schema.title: Campaigns
schema.description: Campaigns and Snippets found for given search term.

results.title: Results
results.description: An array of matching campaigns and snippets.

campaign.title: Campaign
campaign.description: A summary of an individual campaign's settings and content.

id.title: Campaign ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this campaign.

web_id.title: Campaign Web ID
web_id.description: The ID used in the MailChimp web application. View this campaign in your MailChimp account at `https://{dc}.admin.mailchimp.com/campaigns/show/?id={web_id}`.

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: The date and time the campaign was created.

archive_url.title: Archive URL
archive_url.description: The link to the campaign's archive version.

long_archive_url.title: Long Archive URL
long_archive_url.description: The original link to the campaign's archive version.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: The date and time a campaign was sent.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: How the campaign's content is put together ('template', 'drag_and_drop', 'html', 'url').

needs_block_refresh.title: Needs Block Refresh
needs_block_refresh.description: Determines if the campaign needs its blocks refreshed by opening the web-based campaign editor.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique list id.

segment_text.title: Segment Text
segment_text.description: A description of the [segment](http://kb.mailchimp.com/segments/how-to-use-groups-and-segments?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) used for the campaign. Formatted as a string marked up with HTML.

recipient_count.title: Recipient Count
recipient_count.description: Count of the recipients on the associated list. Formatted as an integer.

settings.title: Campaign Settings
settings.description: The settings for your campaign, including subject, from name, reply-to address, and more.

subject_line.title: Campaign Subject Line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

preview_text.title: Campaign Preview Text
preview_text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

title.title: Campaign Title
title.description: The title of the campaign.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The 'from' name on the campaign (not an email address).

reply_to.title: Reply To Address
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the campaign.

use_conversation.title: Conversation
use_conversation.description: Use MailChimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The campaign's custom 'To' name. Typically the first name [merge field](http://kb.mailchimp.com/merge-tags/using/getting-started-with-merge-tags?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

folder_id.title: Folder ID
folder_id.description: If the campaign is listed in a folder, the id for that folder.

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether MailChimp [authenticated](http://kb.mailchimp.com/delivery/deliverability-research/set-up-mailchimp-authentication?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) the campaign. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Automatically append MailChimp's [default footer](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/design/theres-a-gray-footer-added-to-my-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to the campaign.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content.

auto_tweet.title: Auto-Tweet
auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the [campaign archive](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/archives/set-up-your-campaign-archive?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) page when the campaign is sent.

auto_fb_post.title: Auto Post to Facebook
auto_fb_post.description: An array of [Facebook](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/facebook/integrate-facebook-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) page ids to auto-post to.

fb_comments.title: Facebook Comments
fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The id for the template used in this campaign.

drag_and_drop.title: Drag And Drop Campaign
drag_and_drop.description: Whether the campaign uses the drag-and-drop editor.

variate_settings.title: A/B Test Options
variate_settings.description: The settings specific to A/B test campaigns.

winning_campaign_id.title: Winning Campaign ID
winning_campaign_id.description: ID of the campaign that was sent to the remaining recipients based on the winning combination.

winner_criteria.title: Winning Criteria
winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenueâ€”or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the MailChimp web application.

wait_time.title: Wait Time
wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.

test_size.title: Test Size
test_size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.

subject_lines.title: Subject Lines
subject_lines.description: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.

send_times.title: Send Times
send_times.description: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored.

from_names.title: From Names
from_names.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.

reply_to_addresses.title: Reply To Addresses
reply_to_addresses.description: The possible reply-to addresses. The number of reply_to_addresses provided must match the number of from_names. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.

contents.title: Content Descriptions
contents.description: Descriptions of possible email contents. To set campaign contents, make a PUT request to /campaigns/{campaign_id}/content with the field 'variate_contents'.

combinations.title: Combinations
combinations.description: Combinations of possible variables used to build emails.

id.title: ID
id.description: Unique ID for the combination.

subject_line.title: Subject Line
subject_line.description: The index of `variate_settings.subject_lines` used.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The index of `variate_settings.from_names` used.

recipients.title: Recipients
recipients.description: The number of recipients for this combination.

tracking.title: Campaign Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for a campaign.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-open-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs). Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-click-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in the HTML version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-click-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in the plain-text version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics Tracking
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

clicktale.title: ClickTale Analytics Tracking
clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Click-Tale) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

salesforce.title: Salesforce CRM Tracking
salesforce.description: Salesforce tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimp's built-in [Salesforce integration](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/integrate-salesforce-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

campaign.title: Salesforce Campaign
campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

notes.title: Salesforce Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

capsule.title: Capsule CRM Tracking
capsule.description: Capsule tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimp's built-in Capsule integration.

notes.title: Capsule Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

feed_url.title: Feed URL
feed_url.description: The URL for the RSS feed.

frequency.title: Frequency
frequency.description: The frequency of the RSS Campaign.

schedule.title: Sending Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for sending the RSS Campaign.

hour.title: Sending Hour
hour.description: The hour to send the campaign in local time. Acceptable hours are 0-23. For example, '4' would be 4am in [your account's default time zone](http://kb.mailchimp.com/accounts/account-setup/how-to-set-account-defaults?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

daily_send.title: Daily Sending Days
daily_send.description: The days of the week to send a daily RSS Campaign.

sunday.title: Sunday
sunday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Sundays.

monday.title: Monday
monday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Mondays.

tuesday.title: tuesday
tuesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Tuesdays.

wednesday.title: Monday
wednesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Wednesdays.

thursday.title: Thursday
thursday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Thursdays.

friday.title: Friday
friday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Fridays.

saturday.title: Saturday
saturday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Saturdays.

weekly_send_day.title: Weekly Sending Day
weekly_send_day.description: The day of the week to send a weekly RSS Campaign.

monthly_send_date.title: Monthly Sending Day
monthly_send_date.description: The day of the month to send a monthly RSS Campaign. Acceptable days are 0-31, where '0' is always the last day of a month. Months with fewer than the selected number of days will not have an RSS campaign sent out that day. For example, RSS Campaigns set to send on the 30th will not go out in February.

last_sent.title: Last Sent
last_sent.description: The date the campaign was last sent.

constrain_rss_img.title: Constrain RSS Images
constrain_rss_img.description: Whether to add CSS to images in the RSS feed to constrain their width in campaigns.

split_test.title: Split Test
split_test.description: The type of AB split to run.

pick_winner.title: Pick Winner
pick_winner.description: How we should evaluate a winner. Based on 'opens', 'clicks', or 'manual'.

wait_units.title: Wait Time
wait_units.description: How unit of time for measuring the winner ('hours' or 'days'). This cannot be changed after a campaign is sent.

wait_time.title: Wait Time
wait_time.description: The amount of time to wait before picking a winner. This cannot be changed after a campaign is sent.

split_size.title: Split Size
split_size.description: The size of the split groups. Campaigns split based on 'schedule' are forced to have a 50/50 split. Valid split integers are between 1-50.

from_name_a.title: From Name Group A
from_name_a.description: For campaigns split on 'From Name', the name for Group A.

from_name_b.title: From Name Group B
from_name_b.description: For campaigns split on 'From Name', the name for Group B.

reply_email_a.title: Reply Email Group A
reply_email_a.description: For campaigns split on 'From Name', the reply-to address for Group A.

reply_email_b.title: Reply Email Group B
reply_email_b.description: For campaigns split on 'From Name', the reply-to address for Group B.

subject_a.title: Subject Line Group A
subject_a.description: For campaigns split on 'Subject Line', the subject line for Group A.

subject_b.title: Subject Line Group B
subject_b.description: For campaigns split on 'Subject Line', the subject line for Group B.

send_time_a.title: Send Time Group A
send_time_a.description: The send time for Group A.

send_time_b.title: Send Time Group B
send_time_b.description: The send time for Group B.

send_time_winner.title: Send Time Winner
send_time_winner.description: The send time for the winning version.

social_card.title: Campaign Social Card
social_card.description: The preview for the campaign, rendered by social networks like Facebook and Twitter. [Learn more](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/previews-and-tests/set-up-social-cards?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

image_url.title: Image URL
image_url.description: The url for the header image for the card.

description.title: Campaign Description
description.description: A short summary of the campaign to display.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for the card. Typically the subject line of the campaign.

report_summary.title: Campaign Report Summary
report_summary.description: For sent campaigns, a summary of opens, clicks, and e-commerce data.

opens.title: Automation Opens
opens.description: The total number of opens for a campaign.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

clicks.title: Total Clicks
clicks.description: The total number of clicks for an campaign.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

total_orders.title: Total Orders
total_orders.description: The total orders for a campaign.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total spent for a campaign. Calculated as the sum of all order totals with no deductions.

total_revenue.title: Total Revenue
total_revenue.description: The total revenue for a campaign. Calculated as the sum of all order totals minus shipping and tax totals.

get.summary: Ping the API
get.description: A health check for the API that won't return any account-specific information.

health_status.title: API health status
health_status.description: This will return a constant string value if the request is successful. Ex. "Everything's Chimpy!"

condition_type.title: Segment Type
condition_type.description: The type of segment, for example: date, language, Mandrill, static, and more.

op.title: Segment Operator
op.description: The segment operator.

op.title: Operator
op.description: Whether the segment value contains, doesn't contain, is blank, or isn't blank.

value.title: Address Merge Compare Value
value.description: The value to compare.

op.title: Operator
op.description: The member's status, based on their campaign interaction.

value.title: Campaign Web ID
value.description: Either the web id value for a specific campaign or 'any' to account for subscribers who have or have not interacted with any campaigns.

op.title: Operator
op.description: The member's status, based on where they are in an Automation workflow.

value.title: Automation Web ID
value.description: The web id for the Automation workflow to segment on.

op.title: Operator
op.description: Whether the segment value matches exactly, doesn't match, is blank, or isn't blank.

value.title: Birthday Merge Compare Value
value.description: The value to compare.

op.title: Operator
op.description: Members who have or have not interacted with a specific poll in a MailChimp email.

value.title: Poll ID
value.description: The id for the poll.

op.title: Operator
op.description: The status of a member's interaction with a conversation.

value.title: Campaign Web ID
value.description: The web id value for a specific campaign, or 'any' to account for subscribers who have or have not interacted with any campaigns.

op.title: Operator
op.description: Segment members who are in a specific country or US state.

value.title: Country Code or US State
value.description: The two-letter country code or US state abbreviation.

op.title: Operator
op.description: Whether the segment value matches exactly, doesn't match, is blank, or isn't blank.

value.title: Date Merge Compare Value
value.description: The value to compare.

op.title: Operator
op.description: When the event took place.

value.title: Event Type
value.description: What type of data to segment on: a specific date, a specific campaign, or the last campaign sent.

extra.title: Date
extra.description: When segmenting on 'date' or 'campaign', the date for the segment formatted as YYYY-MM-DD or the web id for the campaign.

op.title: Operator
op.description: A member who has purchased from a category or purchased a specific item.

field.title: Ecomm Category or Product
field.description: The e-commerce category or product segment field.

value.title: Ecomm Category or Item
value.description: The e-commerce category or item information.

field.title: Ecomm Number
field.description: The e-commerce number field to segment on.

op.title: Operator
op.description: Members who have spent exactly, have not spent exactly, spent more, or spent less than the segment value.

value.title: Amount Spent
value.description: Members who have spent exactly, have not spent exactly, spent more, or spent less than this amount.

field.title: Ecomm Purchased
field.description: The e-commerce purchased field to segment on.

op.title: Operator
op.description: Members who have have ('member') or have not ('notmember') purchased.

field.title: Ecomm Spent
field.description: The e-commerce spent field to segment on.

op.title: Operator
op.description: Members who have spent more or less than the set value.

value.title: Total Spent
value.description: The total amount a member spent.

field.title: Ecomm Store
field.description: The e-commerce store field to segment on.

HATEOASLinks.title: Links
HATEOASLinks.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

items.title: Resource Link
items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.

href.title: Href
href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'.

targetSchema.title: Target Schema
targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.

AccountDetails.title: API Root
AccountDetails.description: The API root resource links to all other resources available in the API.

account_id.title: Account ID
account_id.description: The MailChimp account ID, used for features like list [subscribe forms](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/signup-forms/create-signup-forms-and-response-emails?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

login_id.title: Login ID
login_id.description: The ID associated with the user who owns this API key. If you can login to multiple accounts, this ID will be the same for each account.

first_name.title: First Name
first_name.description: The first name tied to the account.

last_name.title: Last Name
last_name.description: The last name tied to the account.

username.title: User Name
username.description: The username tied to the account.

avatar_url.title: Avatar URL
avatar_url.description: URL of the avatar for the user.

member_since.title: Account Creation Date
member_since.description: The date and time that the account was created.

pricing_plan_type.title: Account Pricing Plan
pricing_plan_type.description: The type of pricing plan the account is on.

first_payment.title: First Payment
first_payment.description: Date of first payment for monthly plans.

account_timezone.title: Account Timezone
account_timezone.description: The timezone currently set for the account.

account_industry.title: Account Industry
account_industry.description: The user-specified industry associated with the account.

company.title: Company
company.description: The company name for the account.

addr1.title: Address Line 1
addr1.description: The street address for the account contact.

addr2.title: Address Line 2
addr2.description: The street address for the account contact.

city.title: City
city.description: The city for the account contact.

state.title: State
state.description: The state for the account contact.

zip.title: Zip Code
zip.description: The zip code for the account contact.

country.title: Country
country.description: The country for the account contact.

last_login.title: Last Login Date
last_login.description: The date and time of the last login for this account.

total_subscribers.title: Total Subscribers
total_subscribers.description: The total number of subscribers across all lists in the account.

industry_stats.title: Industry Stats
industry_stats.description: The [average campaign statistics](http://mailchimp.com/resources/research/email-marketing-benchmarks/?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) for all campaigns in the account's specified industry.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The average unique open rate for all campaigns in the account's specified industry.

bounce_rate.title: Bounce Rate
bounce_rate.description: The average bounce rate for all campaigns in the account's specified industry.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The average unique click rate for all campaigns in the account's specified industry.

CollectionTotal.title: Item Count
CollectionTotal.description: The total number of items matching the query regardless of pagination.

AutomationRuntime.title: Automation Workflow Runtime Settings
AutomationRuntime.description: A workflow's runtime settings for an Automation.

days.title: Days
days.description: The days an Automation workflow can send.

SegmentationOptions.title: Segment Options
SegmentationOptions.description: An object representing all segmentation options. This object should contain a `saved_segment_id` to use an existing segment, or you can create a new segment by including both `match` and `conditions` options.

saved_segment_id.title: Saved Segment ID
saved_segment_id.description: The id for an existing saved segment.

AutomationWorkflowQueuedSubscriber.title: Subscriber in Automation Queue
AutomationWorkflowQueuedSubscriber.description: Information about subscribers in an Automation email queue.

id.title: Email Hash
id.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address.

workflow_id.title: Workflow ID
workflow_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies an Automation workflow.

email_id.title: Automation Email ID
email_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies an email in an Automation workflow.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies a list.

next_send.title: Next Send
next_send.description: The date and time of the next send for the workflow email.

CampaignType.title: Campaign Type
CampaignType.description: There are four types of [campaigns](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) you can create in MailChimp. A/B Split campaigns have been deprecated and variate campaigns should be used instead.

CampaignStatus.title: Campaign Status
CampaignStatus.description: The current status of the campaign.

DeliveryStatus.title: Campaign Delivery Status
DeliveryStatus.description: Updates on campaigns in the process of sending.

enabled.title: Delivery Status Enabled
enabled.description: Whether Campaign Delivery Status is enabled for this account and campaign.

can_cancel.title: Campaign Cancelable
can_cancel.description: Whether a campaign send can be canceled.

status.title: Campaign Delivery Status
status.description: The current state of a campaign delivery.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails confirmed sent for this campaign so far.

emails_canceled.title: Emails Canceled
emails_canceled.description: The total number of emails canceled for this campaign.

Campaign.title: Campaign
Campaign.description: A summary of an individual campaign's settings and content.

id.title: Campaign ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this campaign.

web_id.title: Campaign Web ID
web_id.description: The ID used in the MailChimp web application. View this campaign in your MailChimp account at `https://{dc}.admin.mailchimp.com/campaigns/show/?id={web_id}`.

create_time.title: Create Time
create_time.description: The date and time the campaign was created.

archive_url.title: Archive URL
archive_url.description: The link to the campaign's archive version.

long_archive_url.title: Long Archive URL
long_archive_url.description: The original link to the campaign's archive version.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: The date and time a campaign was sent.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: How the campaign's content is put together ('template', 'drag_and_drop', 'html', 'url').

needs_block_refresh.title: Needs Block Refresh
needs_block_refresh.description: Determines if the campaign needs its blocks refreshed by opening the web-based campaign editor.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique list id.

segment_text.title: Segment Text
segment_text.description: A description of the [segment](http://kb.mailchimp.com/segments/how-to-use-groups-and-segments?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) used for the campaign. Formatted as a string marked up with HTML.

recipient_count.title: Recipient Count
recipient_count.description: Count of the recipients on the associated list. Formatted as an integer.

settings.title: Campaign Settings
settings.description: The settings for your campaign, including subject, from name, reply-to address, and more.

subject_line.title: Campaign Subject Line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

preview_text.title: Campaign Preview Text
preview_text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

title.title: Campaign Title
title.description: The title of the campaign.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The 'from' name on the campaign (not an email address).

reply_to.title: Reply To Address
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the campaign.

use_conversation.title: Conversation
use_conversation.description: Use MailChimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies.

to_name.title: To Name
to_name.description: The campaign's custom 'To' name. Typically the first name [merge field](http://kb.mailchimp.com/merge-tags/using/getting-started-with-merge-tags?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

folder_id.title: Folder ID
folder_id.description: If the campaign is listed in a folder, the id for that folder.

authenticate.title: Authentication
authenticate.description: Whether MailChimp [authenticated](http://kb.mailchimp.com/delivery/deliverability-research/set-up-mailchimp-authentication?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) the campaign. Defaults to `true`.

auto_footer.title: Auto-Footer
auto_footer.description: Automatically append MailChimp's [default footer](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/design/theres-a-gray-footer-added-to-my-campaign?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) to the campaign.

inline_css.title: Inline CSS
inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content.

auto_tweet.title: Auto-Tweet
auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the [campaign archive](http://kb.mailchimp.com/campaigns/archives/set-up-your-campaign-archive?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) page when the campaign is sent.

auto_fb_post.title: Auto Post to Facebook
auto_fb_post.description: An array of [Facebook](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/facebook/integrate-facebook-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) page ids to auto-post to.

fb_comments.title: Facebook Comments
fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

template_id.title: Template ID
template_id.description: The id for the template used in this campaign.

drag_and_drop.title: Drag And Drop Campaign
drag_and_drop.description: Whether the campaign uses the drag-and-drop editor.

variate_settings.title: A/B Test Options
variate_settings.description: The settings specific to A/B test campaigns.

winning_campaign_id.title: Winning Campaign ID
winning_campaign_id.description: ID of the campaign that was sent to the remaining recipients based on the winning combination.

winner_criteria.title: Winning Criteria
winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenueâ€”or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the MailChimp web application.

wait_time.title: Wait Time
wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.

test_size.title: Test Size
test_size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.

subject_lines.title: Subject Lines
subject_lines.description: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.

send_times.title: Send Times
send_times.description: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored.

from_names.title: From Names
from_names.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.

reply_to_addresses.title: Reply To Addresses
reply_to_addresses.description: The possible reply-to addresses. The number of reply_to_addresses provided must match the number of from_names. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.

contents.title: Content Descriptions
contents.description: Descriptions of possible email contents. To set campaign contents, make a PUT request to /campaigns/{campaign_id}/content with the field 'variate_contents'.

combinations.title: Combinations
combinations.description: Combinations of possible variables used to build emails.

id.title: ID
id.description: Unique ID for the combination.

subject_line.title: Subject Line
subject_line.description: The index of `variate_settings.subject_lines` used.

from_name.title: From Name
from_name.description: The index of `variate_settings.from_names` used.

recipients.title: Recipients
recipients.description: The number of recipients for this combination.

tracking.title: Campaign Tracking Options
tracking.description: The tracking options for a campaign.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: Whether to [track opens](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-open-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs). Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

html_clicks.title: HTML Click Tracking
html_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-click-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in the HTML version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

text_clicks.title: Plain-Text Click Tracking
text_clicks.description: Whether to [track clicks](http://kb.mailchimp.com/reports/about-click-tracking?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) in the plain-text version of the campaign. Defaults to `true`. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

google_analytics.title: Google Analytics Tracking
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for [Google Analytics](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/integrate-google-analytics-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

clicktale.title: ClickTale Analytics Tracking
clicktale.description: The custom slug for [ClickTale](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/additional-tracking-options-for-campaigns?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs#Click-Tale) tracking (max of 50 bytes).

salesforce.title: Salesforce CRM Tracking
salesforce.description: Salesforce tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimp's built-in [Salesforce integration](http://kb.mailchimp.com/integrations/other-integrations/integrate-salesforce-with-mailchimp?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

campaign.title: Salesforce Campaign
campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

notes.title: Salesforce Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

capsule.title: Capsule CRM Tracking
capsule.description: Capsule tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimp's built-in Capsule integration.

notes.title: Capsule Note
notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

feed_url.title: Feed URL
feed_url.description: The URL for the RSS feed.

frequency.title: Frequency
frequency.description: The frequency of the RSS Campaign.

schedule.title: Sending Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for sending the RSS Campaign.

hour.title: Sending Hour
hour.description: The hour to send the campaign in local time. Acceptable hours are 0-23. For example, '4' would be 4am in [your account's default time zone](http://kb.mailchimp.com/accounts/account-setup/how-to-set-account-defaults?utm_source=mc-api&utm_medium=docs&utm_campaign=apidocs).

daily_send.title: Daily Sending Days
daily_send.description: The days of the week to send a daily RSS Campaign.

sunday.title: Sunday
sunday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Sundays.

monday.title: Monday
monday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Mondays.

tuesday.title: tuesday
tuesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Tuesdays.

wednesday.title: Monday
wednesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Wednesdays.

thursday.title: Thursday
thursday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Thursdays.

friday.title: Friday
friday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Fridays.

saturday.title: Saturday
saturday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Saturdays.

weekly_send_day.title: Weekly Sending Day
weekly_send_day.description: The day of the week to send a weekly RSS Campaign.

monthly_send_date.title: Monthly Sending Day
monthly_send_date.description: The day of the month to send a monthly RSS Campaign. Acceptable days are 0-31, where '0' is always the last day of a month. Months with fewer than the selected number of days will not have an RSS campaign sent out that day. For example, RSS Campaigns set to send on the 30th will not go out in February.

last_sent.title: Last Sent
last_sent.description: The date the campaign was last sent.

constrain_rss_img.title: Constrain RSS Images
constrain_rss_img.description: Whether to add CSS to images in the RSS feed to constrain their width in campaigns.

split_test.title: Split Test
split_test.description: The type of AB split to run.

pick_winner.title: Pick Winner
pick_winner.description: How we should evaluate a winner. Based on 'opens', 'clicks', or 'manual'.

wait_units.title: Wait Time
